text: The 1929–30 season was the 57th season of competitive football in Scotland and the 40th season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Rangers Relegated: Dundee United, St Johnstone == Scottish League Division Two == Promoted: Leith Athletic, East Fife == Scottish Cup == Division One champions Rangers were winners of the Scottish Cup after a 2–1 replay win over Partick Thistle. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup |Bathgate |1 – 0 |St Cuthbert Wanderers |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Aberdeen |7 – 5 aggregate over two legs |Fraserburgh |- |align=left|Ayrshire Cup |Kilmarnock | | |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Dumbarton |6 – 2 |Clydebank |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hearts |1 – 1replay - won on corners |Hibernian |- |align=left|Fife Cup |Raith Rovers |3 – 2 |East Fife |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Dundee United |2 – 1 |Montrose |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |4 – 0replay |Celtic |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Motherwell |1 – 0 |Albion Rovers |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |St Johnstone | | |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |St Mirren |3 – 0 |Greenock HSFP |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |St Cuthbert Wanderers |4 – 1 |Newton Stewart |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Falkirk |4 – 0 |Stenhousemuir |} === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Newtongrange Star were winners of the Junior Cup after a 3–0 win over Hall Russell in the final. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |26 October 1929 |Ninian Park, Cardiff (A) | |align=center|4–2 |BHC |Hughie Gallacher (2), Alex James, Jimmy Gibson |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |22 February 1930 |Celtic Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|3–1 |BHC |Hughie Gallacher (2), George Stevenson |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |5 April 1930 |Wembley Stadium, London (A) | |align=center|2–5 |BHC |Jimmy Fleming (2) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |18 May 1930 |Stade de Colombes Paris (A) | |align=center|2–0 |Friendly |Hughie Gallacher (2) |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == References == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive
title: 1929–30 in Scottish football
